result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian S Wargolet was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF279 and 15CF321 called together at 11:14am [mo]
Defendant Brian S Wargolet in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance; submits victim impact statement
recess: 11:14am--reconvene: 11:19am

DA Happ submits Amended Informations
--DA Happ gives arguments in support of Amended Informations
--The Court grants leave of the State to Amend the Information in both cases

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1 and #2 of the Amended Information in Case 15CF279 and the Amended Information in Case 15CF321; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court notes that when preparing the JOC the Clerk is to work from the statutes cited in the Amended Information and NOT those cited in the CCS.

On Counts #1 and #2 of the Amended Information in Case 15CF279 and the Amended Charge in Case 15CF321, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--continue with all therapies and counseling, per Agent
--no presence in any bar, tavern or liquor store
--no possession or ingestion of any alcohol
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence towards anyone
--On Case 15CF279, Count #1: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CF279, Count #2: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CF321: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to submit a DNA sample upon demand

As to Case 15CF279:Days credit for time already served:  2  days
As to Case 15CF321 Days credit for time already served:  3  days

recess: 11:50am
Proposed Stipulation and Order to Modify Bond

Cases 15CF279 and 15CF321 called together at 1:33pm [mo]
Defendant Brian S Wargolet in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF279:
Deputy Ole Olson -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Shock  
--cross examination by Attorney Zarwell


The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Wargolet committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--no demand for speedy trial

As to Case 15CF321:
Deputy Van Callies - sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Shock  
--cross examination by Attorney Zarwell

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Wargolet committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--no demand for speedy trial

The Court discloses that the Court's cousin is a Deputy with Milwaukee Co. Sheriff's Department as does Deputy Callies. The Court does not feel any recusal is needed. 
recess:  2:03pm

NEXT:  As to Both Cases: (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/13/16 at 11:20am  (2) Status Conference on 2/16/16 at 10:00am
IT IS ORDERED that the Defendant's conditions of bond be modified to allow as detailed above to allow him to attend his MRI appointment without the SCRAM bracelet.

Cases 15CF279 and 15CF321 called together at 9:34am [mo]
[Scheduling for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing]
Defendant Brian S Wargolet in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Zarwell raises competency; gives reasoning
The Court questions Mr. Wargolet regarding his education, medication and employment
The Court finds that Mr. Wargolet is able to track the Court's question and provide appropriate answers
The Court finds that Mr. Wargolet IS competent; gives basis

The Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter. 
recess: 9:56am--reconvene: 10:04am[to allow discussion of possible waiver]

The Defense requests that this matter be scheduled for Preliminary Hearing
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
Atty. Zarwell raises that a Stipulation will be submitted to the Court regarding removal a SCRAM bracelet for medical procedure
--The Court indicates that upon submission of the stipulation, it will most likely sign.
recess: 10:08am

NEXT: AS TO BOTH CASES: Preliminary Hearing on 12/4/15 at 1:30pm

ADDRESS INFO for Brian S Wargolet
Current: PO BOX 541, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 10-27-2015)
Prior: PO Box 541, 567 Jay Dr, Watertown, WI 53094 United States

Cases 15CF321 and 15CF279 called together at 2:51pm [mo]
Defendant Brian S Wargolet in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 15CF321(Initial Appearance occurs):
  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court verifies date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint; Mr. Wargolet indicates that he also has a PO Box for mailing.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--No discussion of the facts of the case with Jennifer Machesky and ZRL
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--continue to comply with SCRAM monitoring
--Booking at Jefferson County Sheriff's Dept today

As to Case 15CF279:
The Court orders that the conditions of bond in case 15CF279 to match those in case 15CF320, with the no possession of any dangerous weapons condition and no discussion of the facts of the case with ZRL remaining. 
recess: 3:02pm

NEXT: As to Both Cases: Preliminary Hearing on 11/16/15 at 9:00am
for continuance tim eof status conference on 10/27/15 changed from 10:30 am to 2:00 pm

Case called at 8:11am [mo]
Defendant Brian S Wargolet in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

On the State's Motion for Bond Modification:
--Atty. Zarwell verifies receipt of the State's Motion
--Atty. Zarwell indicates that the SCRAM portion of the Bond Modification has already been completed; Mr. Wargolet already has already been fitted with SCRAM since last court date

Bond arguments given by Counsel

Upon inquiry from the Court, Atty. Zarwell indicates that Mr. Wargolet is voluntarily partaking in SCRAM monitoring. 

The Court does not modify the signature bond to cash at this time
The Court denies the State's Motion for Bond Modification
The Court orders Mr. Wargolet to continue complying with SCRAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services. 
recess: 8:27am

Case called at 2:52pm [mo]
Defendant Brian S Wargolet in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.
[Todays hearing was scheduled on the State's Motion for Bond Modification]

recess: 2:57pm--reconvene:3:24pm [to allow Atty. Zarwell to discuss the Bond Modification with DA Happ]
--Atty. Zarwell indicates that he was unable to speak with DA Happ
--ADA Beck requests for this hearing to be adjourned for a week to allow the communications to continue between Atty. Zarwell and DA Happ, regarding the State's Motion for Bond Modification
The Court adjourns this motion hearing.
recess: 3:28pm

NEXT: Motion Hearing on 10/19/15 at 8:10am (State's Motion for Bond Modification}

ADDRESS INFO for Brian S Wargolet
Current: PO Box 541, 567 Jay Dr, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2015)
Prior: 2915 W. Ramsey Ave, Greenfield, WI 53221

[MK] case called at 1:30pm. 
Defendant Brian S Wargolet appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Wargolet verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Complaint are correct. 
The Court finds the videoconferencing system to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with the juvenile Z.R.L. or with Jennifer Machesky 
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--no possession of any dangerous weapons as defined by Statute [Statute 939.22(10)]
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
recess 1:35pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/23/15 at 10:20am   (2) Status Conference at 10/27/15 at 10:30am.
